snippet: A senior official of the Russian Orthodox Church warned that if government authorities do not respond to people’s concerns they could be “slowly eaten alive.”
abstract: Senior official of the Russian Orthodox Church in Moscow has indicated that the church is moving toward a middle position between the government and opponents who have staged two huge demonstrations; calls for a national dialogue to address the interests of the entire population.
lead_paragraph: A senior official of the Russian Orthodox Church warned that if government authorities do not respond to people’s concerns they could be “slowly eaten alive.”

headline.seo: Orthodox Church Hints It May Be Mediator in Russia
headline.main: Church Hints It May Serve as Mediator in Russia
headline.print_headline: Church Hints It May Serve As Mediator In Russia
